snippet: Aides to the New Jersey governor say his journey to Mexico is about economic ties and commitment to Hispanic voters back home, but it will also offer him a chance to demonstrate a grasp of international affairs as he considers a run for the...
abstract: Chris Christie's trip to Mexico offers New Jersey governor chance to demonstrate his grasp of international affairs as he continues to consider run from presidency in 2016; Christie has been candid about his limited knowledge on foreign policy, acknowledging shortfalls on grasping its intricacies and nuances.
lead_paragraph: Aides to the New Jersey governor say his journey to Mexico is about economic ties and commitment to Hispanic voters back home, but it will also offer him a chance to demonstrate a grasp of international affairs as he considers a run for the presidency.

headline.main: Christie Studies Foreign Affairs for a 2016 Test
headline.print_headline: Christie Studies Global Affairs for a 2016 Test
